intro: Aneimiaebotrys asper, commonly known as the rough-stemmed anemone, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, hairy stems that are often covered in fine, rough textures. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers with five petals, blooming in early to mid-summer. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a serrated or lobed edge, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Aneimiaebotrys asper prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded garden settings.
